events.originalText: The House of Lords Act was given royal assent, removing most hereditary peers from the British House of Lords.
events.subtitle: House of Lords Act 1999
events.headline: House of Lords Act removes hereditary peers from British House of Lords

events.originalText: During a constitutional crisis, Governor-General John Kerr (pictured) dismissed Prime Minister Gough Whitlam's government and dissolved the Parliament of Australia for a double-dissolution election.
events.subtitle: 1975 Australian constitutional crisis
events.headline: Governor-General John Kerr dismisses Prime Minister Gough Whitlam's government in Australia

events.originalText: Rhodesia, led by Prime Minister Ian Smith, unilaterally declared independence from the United Kingdom.
events.subtitle: Rhodesia
events.headline: Rhodesia declares independence from the United Kingdom under Prime Minister Ian Smith

events.originalText: A coup attempt by the Army of the Republic of Vietnam against President Ngô Đình Diệm was crushed after he falsely promised reform, allowing loyalists to rescue him.
events.subtitle: 1960 South Vietnamese coup attempt
events.headline: Coup attempt against President Ngô Đình Diệm crushed in Vietnam

events.originalText: Second World War: The Royal Navy launched the first all-aircraft ship-to-ship naval attack in history against the Italians in the Battle of Taranto.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Royal Navy launches first all-aircraft ship-to-ship naval attack in Battle of Taranto

events.originalText: The Shrine of Remembrance (pictured), a memorial to all Australians who have served in war, opened in Melbourne.
events.subtitle: Shrine of Remembrance
events.headline: Shrine of Remembrance opens in Melbourne as memorial to Australian war veterans

events.originalText: The plan for the United States Numbered Highway System was approved by the American Association of State Highway Officials.
events.subtitle: United States Numbered Highway System
events.headline: United States Numbered Highway System plan approved

events.originalText: In London, the Cenotaph was unveiled and the Unknown Warrior was buried in Westminster Abbey in remembrance of the First World War.
events.subtitle: The Cenotaph
events.headline: Cenotaph unveiled and Unknown Warrior buried in Westminster Abbey in London

events.originalText: The armistice between the German Empire and the Allies was signed in a railway carriage in the Forest of Compiègne of France (signatories pictured).
events.subtitle: Armistice of 11 November 1918
events.headline: Armistice signed between German Empire and Allies in Forest of Compiègne

events.originalText: Józef Piłsudski, appointed the commander-in-chief of Polish forces by the Regency Council, was entrusted with the creation of a national government for the newly independent Poland.
events.subtitle: Józef Piłsudski
events.headline: Józef Piłsudski entrusted with creation of national government for newly independent Poland

events.originalText: Australian bushranger and outlaw Ned Kelly was hanged in spite of sympathizers holding rallies for his reprieve.
events.subtitle: Bushranger
events.headline: Australian bushranger Ned Kelly hanged despite rallies for reprieve

events.originalText: War of 1812: A British–Canadian force repelled an American attack at the Battle of Crysler's Farm, forcing the United States to give up their attempt to capture Montreal.
events.subtitle: War of 1812
events.headline: British–Canadian force repels American attack at Battle of Crysler's Farm in War of 1812

events.originalText: War of the Third Coalition: French, Austrian and Russian units suffered heavy losses at the Battle of Dürenstein.
events.subtitle: War of the Third Coalition
events.headline: French, Austrian, and Russian units suffer heavy losses at Battle of Dürenstein in War of the Third Coalition

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: British forces and their Iroquois allies attacked a fort and the village of Cherry Valley, New York, killing 14 soldiers and 30 civilians.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: British forces and Iroquois allies attack fort and village in Cherry Valley, New York

events.originalText: The Fourth Lateran Council convened in Rome, during which the Catholic doctrine of transubstantiation was defined.
events.subtitle: Fourth Council of the Lateran
events.headline: Fourth Lateran Council defines Catholic doctrine of transubstantiation in Rome
